verses.roman:
śrī-bhagavān uvāca
yadunaivaṁ mahā-bhāgo
brahmaṇyena su-medhasā
pṛṣṭaḥ sabhājitaḥ prāha
praśrayāvanataṁ dvijaḥ

synonyms: śrī-bhagavān uvāca—the Supreme Personality of Godhead said; yadunā—by King Yadu; evam—in this way; mahā-bhāgaḥ—greatly fortunate; brahmaṇyena—who was very respectful to brāhmaṇas; su-medhasā—and intelligent; pṛṣṭaḥ—asked; sabhājitaḥ—honored; prāha—he spoke; praśraya—out of humility; avanatam—bowing his head; dvijaḥ—the brāhmaṇa.
translation: Lord Kṛṣṇa continued: The intelligent King Yadu, always respectful to the brāhmaṇas, waited with bowed head as the brāhmaṇa, pleased with the King's attitude, began to reply.
